snippet: Current and former General Services Administration officials faced bipartisan questioning Monday over an $800,000 Las Vegas conference.
abstract: Democrats and Republicans on a Congressional oversight committee, in a rare show of unity, question Martha N Johnson, the former head of the General Services Administration, and other agency officials about profligate spending at a conference held in Las Vegas in 2010, which cost more than $800,000.
lead_paragraph: Current and former General Services Administration officials faced bipartisan questioning Monday over an $800,000 Las Vegas conference.

headline.seo: Panel Grills G.S.A. Officials Over Lavish Conference
headline.main: G.S.A. Officials Get a Grilling Over a Trip to Las Vegas
headline.print_headline: Panel Unites In Anger Over a Trip To Las Vegas
